activities.loc: Branch 2 Courtroom, 2nd Floor, Oneida County Courthouse
Branch 2 Courtroom, 2nd Floor, Oneida County Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan A. Mielke

records.addlTxt: Letter to Defendant re: payment of attorney fees

2:36 PM Defendant Ryan A. Mielke in court. Attorney Brian F. Bennett in court for Ryan A. Mielke. Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Bennett states has discovery - possible resolution - would like to set out. Bond continued. adj. 02:39 PM
Jury trial scheduled for January 18, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

3:35 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ryan A. Mielke in court.  Attorney Brian F. Bennett in court for Ryan A. Mielke. 
In receipt of information, waive reading.  Not guilty plea.
Bail continued.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Answer to demand for discovery and inspection

records.addlTxt: No intoxicants/No taverns/Not to possess any firearm/Not to go onto any State of Federal office except for the veterans administration/not go onto any public place unless for food, shelter or clothing. No contact with any employee with the Oneida County Department of Social Services or Social Services employee R.L.K./Not to come onto premises of the Oneida County Court House unless for court appearance

9:53 AM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Ryan Anthony Mielkie appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Brian F. Bennett in court for Ryan Anthony Mielkie. State calls Oneida County Sheriff's Patrol Deputy Michael Horwath/sworn/direct by Schiek/witness identifies Defendant/cross by Bennett/witness is excused. Bennett/Schiek statement to probable cause. Court finds probable cause exists and binds Defendant over. Schiek would like to to set a separate arrangement date. Bennett/Schiek statement to bond. Court sets signature bond. adj. 10:17 AM
Arraignment scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

01:07 PM Prosecuting attorney Mary M. Sowinski in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Ryan Anthony Mielkie appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Brian F. Bennett in court for Ryan Anthony Mielkie. Court review of case. In receipt of complaint, waive reading - set for preliminary hearing. Bennett/Sowinski statement to bond. Court questions Bennett on needs of Defendant if released. Bennett states has contacted veteran office and will meet with them. Court is taking request for bond modification under advisement - states reasons and continues bond. adj. 01:19 PM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 09:45 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Bennett appointed by Court - Defendant to repay $100/month

2:06 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Ryan Anthony Mielkie appeared by video, in custody. 
Court questions defendant to counsel.  Defendant unable to call counsel.  Court questions regarding Public defender -advises to call PD appointment. 
Court continues bail.  Court will attempt to contact Veteran service office to see if they can assist.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

2:47 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ryan Anthony Mielkie appeared by video, in custody. Court review of case. Defendant states he will be retaining counsel does not have his contact information. Court will set out. Defendant/Pfeifer statement to bond. Court takes request under advisement. adj. 02:49 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

No contact with any employee with the Oneida County Department of Social Services or Social Services employee R.L.K./Not to come onto premises of the Oneida County Court House unless for court appearance

1:19 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Ryan Anthony Mielkie appeared by video, in custody. Defendant declines to answer Court if received copy of the complaint - Court reads charges, right to counsel. Schiek statement to bail. Court sets bond. adj. 01:26 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
